name: ResourceTypeFilter
description: An extension that enables additional features for single resource types

attributes.name: singletonEndpoint
attributes.description: a boolean that tells us if the endpoint is used as singleton endpoint. This feature may be used e.g. for the /ServiceProviderConfig endpoint to delegate a list-request to a simple get-request.

attributes.name: autoFiltering
attributes.description: a boolean that will enable automatic filtering on the given resource. If enabled the developer will not receive any filter information's anymore.

attributes.name: autoSorting
attributes.description: a boolean that will enable automatic sorting on the given resource. If enabled the developer will not receive any sorting information's anymore.

attributes.name: etag
attributes.description: a complex type configuration for eTags that describes how the automatic API handling should use ETags

subAttributes.name: enabled
subAttributes.description: a boolean if set to false ETags will not be generated automatically on this resource endpoint. Default is false.

attributes.name: endpointControl
attributes.description: a complex attribute that allows you to enable or disable specific endpoints for specific resources. An example would be to disable the create and the delete endpoint

subAttributes.name: disableCreate
subAttributes.description: disables the create endpoint if set to true.

subAttributes.name: disableGet
subAttributes.description: disables the get endpoint if set to true.

subAttributes.name: disableList
subAttributes.description: disables the list endpoint if set to true.

subAttributes.name: disableUpdate
subAttributes.description: disables the update and the patch endpoint if set to true.

subAttributes.name: disableDelete
subAttributes.description: disables the delete endpoint if set to true.

attributes.name: authorization
attributes.description: a complex attribute that tells us the which roles the client must have to access the given endpoint

subAttributes.name: authenticated
subAttributes.description: tells us if access to this endpoint will require authentication. Default is true

subAttributes.name: roles
subAttributes.description: the roles the client must have to access the resource endpoint. This setting defines the roles necessary for all endpoints [create, get, list, update, patch, delete]. This setting may be overridden by other attributes

subAttributes.name: rolesCreate
subAttributes.description: the roles the client must have to access the create endpoint.(overrides the attribute "roles" the create endpoint only)

subAttributes.name: rolesGet
subAttributes.description: the roles the client must have to access the get endpoint.(overrides the attribute "roles" the get endpoint only)

subAttributes.name: rolesUpdate
subAttributes.description: the roles the client must have to access the update or patch endpoint.(overrides the attribute "roles" the update endpoint only)

subAttributes.name: rolesDelete
subAttributes.description: the roles the client must have to access the update or patch endpoint.(overrides the attribute "roles" the delete endpoint only)
